Persistent generalized lymphadenopathy (PGL) Unexplained, asymptomatic hepatosplenomegaly
Extensive HPV or molluscum infection (>5% of body area/face)
Recurrent oral ulcerations (>2 episodes/ in 6 months)
Recurrent or chronic upper respiratory infection (URI)
Unexplained moderate malnutrition (-2SD or Z score) not responding to standard therapy
Severe recurrent presumed bacterial pneumonia (>2 episodes/12 months)
Unexplained anaemia, neutropenia, or thrombocytopenia for >1 mo.
Unexplained severe wasting or severe malnutrition (-3 SD or Z score) not responding to standard therapy
CMV infection of organ other than liver, spleen, lymph nodes
Fevers for two or more weeks
Noticeable weight loss for new patients or 3 kgs
Weight loss in a month (subsequent visit)
Excessive sweating at night for two or more weeks

Displacement of the device, including intentional movement of device by the client and/or self-removal, that requires surgical intervention, hospitalization, or transfer to another facility to clinically manage.
Part or all of the glans or shaft of the penis severed
Transient complaint that resolves without treatment
Requires a special return to the cinic, but no additional treatment required
Requires referral to another facility for management
Healing takes longer than usual, but no extra treatment necessary
Client concerned, but no discernible abnormality
Significant wound disruption or scarring, but does not require re-operation
Adds time or material needs to the procedure, but does not result in any discernible adverse condition
Skin is tight, but additional operative work not necessary
Requires re-operation or transfer to another facility to correct the problem
Complete or partial amputation of the glans or shaft of the penis
AE that results in disability that is likely permanent ( e.g glans numbness)
AE that results in anatomic deformity that is likely permanent ( e.g keloid,scaring,penile torsion etc)
Moderate or severe device displacement AE
Any admission to ICU within 30 days post Male Circumcision
Client deaths within 30days post Male Circumcision
Displacement of the device after which no other treatment needed beyond routine post-removal wound care.
Displacement of the device that requires any treatment more than routine post-operative wound care but does not meet severe criteria.

Displacement of the device, including intentional movement of device by the client and/or self-removal, that requires surgical intervention, hospitalization, or transfer to another facility to clinically manage.
Detachment of the device that requires any treatment more than routine post-operative wound care but does not meet severe criteria.
Detachment of the device after which no other treatment needed beyond routine post-removal wound care.
Blood transfusion or transfer to another facility required
Bleeding that requires pressure dressing to control
More bleeding than usual, but easily controlled
Reaction to anaesthetic requiring medical treatment in clinic, but not transfer to another facility
Anaphylaxis or other reaction requiring transfer to another facility
Mild bruising or abrasion, not requiring treatment
Bruising or abrasion of the glans or shaft of the penis requiring pressure dressing or additional surgery to control
